page.title: 13St.Mary's Church, Wenvoe.
page.content: In this pleasant rural setting, where farmland dominates the landscape, St.Mary's Church stands in the centre of the community. It is uncertain when the church was actually completed but the first Rector recorded was { {Simon de Tothal}in 1350. The present Rector, James Thomas, has been at St.Mary's since 1976. The tower of this beautiful little church was moved en bloc in 1699 from the north side to the east for reasons now unknown. There are many interesting features to the church which clearly reflect the architectural style of the age, including stained glass windows, carved figures on the altar and the pulpit. The seating in the porch indicates that the church was also used as a school.
